alert.note: Alert for Jones; Nolan; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:08PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jones, eastern Nolan and western Taylor Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1008 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hylton, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackwell, Nolan, Merkel, Trent, Hylton, Noodle, Happy Valley, Coronados Camp, Shep, Lake Sweetwater, Camp Butman, Stith, Truby and The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 251 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
